skill.name: omarchy-theming
skill.description: Create and manage Omarchy desktop themes. Use when working with colors.toml, terminal themes (Alacritty/Kitty/Ghostty), Hyprland colors, Waybar styling, btop themes, or theme installation/removal.
skill.summary: Create and manage Omarchy desktop themes. Use when working with colors.toml, terminal themes (Alacri...
skill.author: BitYoungjae

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only markdown guides and configuration examples. No executable code, no network calls, no file system access, and no external command execution capabilities.

content.value_statement: Creating consistent desktop themes across multiple applications is complex and time-consuming. Omarchy theming provides a centralized colors.toml configuration that automatically generates themes for all desktop applications including terminals, window managers, and system tools.
actual_capabilities: Create colors.toml theme files with 22 required color variables
Generate themes for terminal emulators (Alacritty, Kitty, Ghostty)
Configure Hyprland and Waybar styling from centralized colors
Create supporting theme files for neovim, VS Code, btop, and browsers
Apply light and dark theme modes with appropriate color schemes
Troubleshoot theme application and variable format issues
limitations: Does not execute theme installation commands (user must run omarchy CLI)
Cannot access local theme files for editing (purely prompt-based)
Only supports HEX color format (#RRGGBB), not RGB or HSL
Does not generate wallpaper images or preview graphics

use_cases.title: Unified Desktop Theme
use_cases.description: Create a single colors.toml that generates consistent Hyprland borders, Waybar styling, and terminal colors across your entire desktop environment.

use_cases.title: Matching Editor Theme
use_cases.description: Generate coordinated themes for neovim, VS Code, and terminals from one configuration file for a distraction-free coding environment.

use_cases.title: Multi-App Theming
use_cases.description: Apply the same color palette to Alacritty, Kitty, Ghostty, btop, Mako notifications, and browsers with minimal configuration effort.

prompt_templates.title: Create Dark Theme
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a new Omarchy dark theme called 'catppuccin-dark' with the Mocha color palette. Include colors.toml with all 22 variables, a neovim.lua file for LazyVim, and a btop.theme file.

prompt_templates.title: Convert Color Format
prompt_templates.scenario: HEX to RGB for browser theme
prompt_templates.prompt: What RGB format does omarchy-theming use for chromium.theme files? Show me how to convert #1e1e2e to the required format.

prompt_templates.title: Light Mode Theme
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a light Omarchy theme with a light blue accent color (#1e66f5), light gray background (#eff1f5), and show how to create the light.mode marker file.

prompt_templates.title: Fix Theme Issues
prompt_templates.prompt: My terminal colors are not applying after running omarchy-theme-set. What variables might be missing from colors.toml and what format should they use?

output_examples.input: Create a Tokyo Night dark theme for Omarchy with all 22 color variables

best_practices: Define all 22 color variables in colors.toml to avoid errors during theme generation
Use the _strip suffix for Hyprland rgb() function and _rgb suffix for rgba() values
Test themes with omarchy-theme-set after changes and verify each application
anti_patterns: Using RGB, HSL, or named colors instead of HEX format in colors.toml
Missing the backgrounds/ directory with at least one wallpaper image
Forgetting to create empty light.mode file for light theme variants

faq.question: Which terminal emulators does Omarchy support?
faq.answer: Omarchy supports Alacritty, Kitty, and Ghostty with dedicated template files for each.

faq.question: What happens if I miss color variables in colors.toml?
faq.answer: Missing variables cause errors when running omarchy-theme-set. All 22 variables are required.

faq.question: Can I use Omarchy themes with applications outside the template list?
faq.answer: Yes, create static config files in your theme directory to override generated templates.

faq.question: Is my theme data stored securely?
faq.answer: Yes, themes are stored locally in ~/.config/omarchy/themes with no external data transmission.

faq.question: Why are my colors not applying to specific applications?
faq.answer: Check that the template variable names match your colors.toml keys and use the correct format suffix.

faq.question: How does Omarchy compare to other theming tools?
faq.answer: Omarchy uses centralized configuration with automatic propagation rather than per-application theme files.
